description: Unique name
Name of bus to which generator is attached
P,Q,V control strategy for power flow, must be "PQ", "PV" or "Slack". Only relevant for "AC" and "DC" buses.
Placeholder for generator type. Not implemented.
Nominal power for limits  on `p` in optimization. Ignored if `p_nom_extendable=True`.
Nominal power of the generator module (e.g. fixed unit size of a nuclear power plant). Introduces integer variables if set.
Switch to allow capacity `p_nom` to be extended in optimization.
If `p_nom` is extendable in optimization, set its minimum value.
If `p_nom` is extendable in optimization, set its maximum value (e.g. limited by technical potential).
If `p_nom` is extendable in optimization, set its value.

The minimum output for each snapshot per unit of `p_nom` for the optimization (e.g. a minimal dispatch level for conventional power plants). Note that if `committable=False` and `p_min_pu>0`, this represents a must-run condition.

The maximum output for each snapshot per unit of `p_nom` for the optimization (e.g. changing availability of renewable generators due to weather conditions or a de-rating of conventional power plants).
Active power set point (for optimisation and power flow)
Active power used as a starting point for limiting the ramp in the very first snapshot (for optimisation)
The minimum total energy produced during a single optimization horizon.
The maximum total energy produced during a single optimization horizon.
Reactive power set point (for power flow)
Sign denoting the orientation of the dispatch variable (e.g. positive for generation, negative for consumption).
Prime mover energy carrier (e.g. coal, gas, wind, solar); required for global constraints on primary energy in optimisation
Marginal cost of production of 1 MWh.
Quadratic marginal cost of production of 1 MWh.
Whether to consider the component in optimization or not
Build year of the generator.
Lifetime of the generator.
Fixed period costs of extending `p_nom` by 1 MW (e.g. annuitized investment costs). Used directly in optimization unless `overnight_cost` is specified.
Overnight (upfront) investment cost per MW. If specified, PyPSA calculates annuity using `discount_rate` and `lifetime`. Takes precedence over `capital_cost`.
Discount rate for annuity calculation when using `overnight_cost`. Supports 0% rate (simple depreciation).
Fixed period operation and maintenance costs per MW, added to annuitized investment cost.
Ratio output and primary energy carrier input (e.g. 0.4 MWh~elec~/MWh~fuel~). This is required for global constraints on primary energy in optimization.
Apply unit commitment constraints. This is only possible with `p_nom_extendable=False`.
Cost to start up the generator. Only used if `committable=True`.
Cost to shut down the generator. Only used if `committable=True`.
Stand-by cost for running the generator. This cost is incurred whenever the status is 1 (including when the dispatch decision is zero).
Minimum number of snapshots for status to be 1. Only used if `committable=True`. Does not consider snapshot weightings.
Minimum number of snapshots for status to be 0. Only used if `committable=True`. Does not consider snapshot weightings.
Number of snapshots that the generator was online before `n.snapshots` start. Only used if `committable=True` and `min_up_time>0`. Does not consider snapshot weightings.
Number of snapshots that the generator was offline before `n.snapshots` start. Only used if `committable=True` and `min_down_time>0`. Does not consider snapshot weightings.
Maximum active power increase from one snapshot to the next, per unit of the nominal power. Ignored if NaN. Does not consider snapshot weightings.
Maximum active power decrease from one snapshot to the next, per unit of the nominal power. Ignored if NaN. Does not consider snapshot weightings.
Maximum active power increase at start up, per unit of the nominal power. Only used if `committable=True`. Ignored if NaN.
Maximum active power decrease at shut down, per unit of the nominal power. Only used if `committable=True`. Ignored if NaN.
Weighting of a generator. Only used for network clustering.
Active power at bus (positive if net generation)
Reactive power (positive if net generation)
Optimised nominal capacity.
Status in the snapshot (1 is on, 0 is off). Only returned if `committable=True`.
Whether the unit was started in the snapshot (1 is yes, 0 is no). Only returned if `committable=True`.
Whether the unit was shut down in the snapshot (1 is yes, 0 is no).  Only returned if `committable=True`.
Shadow price of upper `p_nom` limit
Shadow price of lower `p_nom` limit
Shadow price of fixed power generation `p_set`
Shadow price of upper ramp up limit
Shadow price of lower ramp down limit
